result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernita De Leon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 2:13 PM Defendant Bernita De Leon in court.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson in court for Bernita De Leon.  Attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest; Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders sentence withheld, 12 months probation, any treatment deemed necessary, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, costs due to Clerk of Court, 5 days sentence credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

2:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bernita De Leon not in court.  Attorney Walter H Isaacson in court for Bernita De Leon.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Calendar call on July 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

01:51 PM Defendant Bernita De Leon in court by phone with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Intern Margaret Ginocchio by video supervised by David Zarwell by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.
